private_information: I specialize in normalizing operator schemas from informal descriptions.
I summarize action names, parameters, preconditions, and effects without emitting PDDL.
I ensure predicate names and arities are consistent across actions.
actions_expert.goal: Provide a clean, unambiguous set of action schemas for the orchestrator to compile into PDDL.

private_information: I translate narrative initial conditions, goals, and optional reference plans into structured, machine-readable facts.
I maintain object naming consistency and identify the exact set of symbols used in each scenario.
state_expert.goal: Provide structured initial states and goals for Scenario A and Scenario B, and package the Scenario A reference plan.

private_information: I check that the reference plan for Scenario A is consistent with the action schemas and initial state.
I do not produce PDDL; I only validate feasibility and highlight inconsistencies if any.
plan_analyst.goal: Validate the Scenario A plan against the action schemas and produce a concise feasibility assessment.

private_information: I integrate action schemas, states, and validations from the other agents.
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver.
I will build the problem for Scenario B, while optionally using Scenario A for cross-checks.
orchestrator.goal: Emit a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the task for Scenario B and are suitable for the FastDownward solver.

public_information: This environment models a set of objects object_0 through object_14 with unary predicates hand, cats, sneeze, texture, spring, stupendous and binary predicates collect, vase, next.
Action paltry(o0 o1 o2): Preconditions = {hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2}; Add effects = {next o0 o2}; Delete effects = {vase o0 o1}.
Action sip(o0 o1 o2): Preconditions = {hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2}; Add effects = {vase o0 o1}; Delete effects = {next o0 o2}.
Action clip(o0 o1 o2): Preconditions = {hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2}; Add effects = {vase o0 o1}; Delete effects = {next o0 o2}.
Action wretched(o0 o1 o2 o3): Preconditions = {sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3}; Add effects = {next o0 o2}; Delete effects = {next o0 o1}.
Action memory(o0 o1 o2): Preconditions = {cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1}; Add effects = {next o0 o2}; Delete effects = {next o0 o1}.
Action tightfisted(o0 o1 o2): Preconditions = {hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1}; Add effects = {next o0 o2}; Delete effects = {vase o0 o1}.

Scenario A initial facts: {cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_5, next object_13 object_7, next object_14 object_9, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_9, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9}.
Scenario A goal facts: {next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_8, next object_13 object_5, next object_14 object_7}.

Scenario A reference plan: clip object_14 object_4 object_9; wretched object_3 object_6 object_7 object_1; clip object_13 object_3 object_7; wretched object_4 object_9 object_10 object_2; clip object_11 object_4 object_10; wretched object_4 object_10 object_8 object_2; tightfisted object_14 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_9 object_2; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_9; sip object_14 object_0 object_8; memory object_0 object_8 object_5; paltry object_14 object_0 object_5; sip object_12 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_8; paltry object_12 object_0 object_8; wretched object_3 object_7 object_5 object_1; clip object_14 object_3 object_5; tightfisted object_13 object_3 object_5; wretched object_3 object_5 object_7 object_1; tightfisted object_14 object_3 object_7.

Scenario B initial facts: {cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_8, next object_13 object_6, next object_14 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_10, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9}.
Scenario B goal facts: {next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_6, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_7}.

extract_actions.system_prompt: You convert the public action descriptions into a normalized set of operator schemas without emitting PDDL; ensure names, parameters, preconditions, and effects are unambiguous and consistent.
extract_actions.prompt: Your name is actions_expert. Read the shared context {environment->public_information}. Produce a concise JSON list of action schemas with keys: name, parameters (ordered list like [o0, o1, ...]), preconditions (list of strings), add_effects (list of strings), del_effects (list of strings). Do not invent new actions or predicates; do not output PDDL; enclose your JSON in <actions></actions>.

extract_states.system_prompt: You structure scenario initial states, goals, and any reference plan into machine-readable JSON that other agents can consume.
extract_states.prompt: Your name is state_expert. From {environment->public_information}, extract Scenario A initial facts, Scenario A goals, Scenario A reference plan, Scenario B initial facts, and Scenario B goals. Output a JSON object with keys: scenario_A_init, scenario_A_goal, scenario_A_plan, scenario_B_init, scenario_B_goal; represent facts as lists of strings and the plan as an ordered list of action strings; enclose the JSON in <states></states>.

validate_plan.system_prompt: You validate the feasibility of the provided plan for Scenario A against the action schemas and initial state.
validate_plan.prompt: Your name is plan_analyst. Using the action schemas {action_schemas} and the structured states {scenario_states}, check whether the Scenario A plan is potentially valid under STRIPS semantics with add and delete lists. Report any step that violates preconditions or leads to inconsistencies. Output a short JSON with keys: status (PASS or FAIL), issues (list), and notes; enclose it in <assessment></assessment>.

compile_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL and the FastDownward solver; you compile provided schemas and states into a final domain and problem.
compile_pddl.prompt: Integrate the action schemas {action_schemas} and the structured states {scenario_states}; use the plan assessment {plan_assessment} only as a cross-check. Produce one PDDL domain and one PDDL problem for Scenario B targeting FastDownward. Requirements should include :strips and optionally :typing; use a single type obj for all objects. Predicates must include hand ?x - obj, cats ?x - obj, sneeze ?x - obj, texture ?x - obj, spring ?x - obj, stupendous ?x - obj, collect ?x ?y - obj, vase ?x ?y - obj, next ?x ?y - obj. Implement the six operators exactly as specified by the schemas. The problem must list all objects object_0 through object_14, initialize exactly the Scenario B initial facts, and set the Scenario B goals. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem> and ensure the output is directly usable by FastDownward.
